Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.io

Class SwapOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • nl.naturalis.common.io.SwapOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SwapFileOutputStream
    public abstract class SwapOutputStream
extends OutputStream
    An output stream implementing a swap mechanism. A SwapOutputStream first fills up an internal buffer. If the buffer reaches full capacity, it is flushed to an underlying output stream. From then onwards all write actions are forwarded to the underlying output stream. The underlying output stream would typically write to some form of persistent storage (e.g. a swap file). It is transparent to clients whether or not data has actually been swapped out of memory. Once they are done writing data, clients can collect the data without having to know whether or not it was swapped. The collection mechanism is left to concrete subclasses of SwapOutputStream.

    This class is not thread-safe. If necessary, method calls must be synchronized externally by the caller.

    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SwapOutputStream​(OutputStream swapTo)
      Creates a SwapOutputStream with an internal buffer of 4 kilobytes, swapping to the specified OutputStream once the buffer overflows.
      SwapOutputStream​(OutputStream swapTo, int treshold)
      Creates a SwapOutputStream with an internal buffer of treshold bytes, swapping to the specified OutputStream once the buffer overflows.

      • SwapOutputStream

        public SwapOutputStream​(OutputStream swapTo)
        Creates a SwapOutputStream with an internal buffer of 4 kilobytes, swapping to the specified OutputStream once the buffer overflows.
        Parameters:
        swapTo - The output stream to which data is written once the internal buffer overflows

      • SwapOutputStream

        public SwapOutputStream​(OutputStream swapTo,
                        int treshold)
        Creates a SwapOutputStream with an internal buffer of treshold bytes, swapping to the specified OutputStream once the buffer overflows.
        Parameters:
        The - output stream to which data is written once the internal buffer overflows
        treshold - The size in bytes of the internal buffer

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write​(int b)
           throws IOException
        Writes the specified byte to this output stream. If this causes an overflow of the internal buffer, the buffer is flushed to the underlying output stream and all subsequent write actions will be forwarded to the underlying output stream.
        Specified by:
        write in class OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

        public void write​(byte[] b,
                  int off,
                  int len)
           throws IOException
        Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this output stream. If this causes an overflow of the internal buffer, the buffer is flushed to the underlying output stream and all subsequent write actions will be forwarded to the underlying output stream.
        Overrides:
        write in class OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException

      • collect

        public abstract void collect​(OutputStream output)
                      throws IOException
        Retrieves all data written to this SwapOutputStream and writes it to the specified output stream. Subclasses are expected to close the underlying output stream, even if no data has been written it yet (in which case they would only have to read the contents of the internal buffer).
        Parameters:
        output - The output stream to which to write the data
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
             throws IOException
        Deletes the resource that the underlying output stream was writing to (e.g. a swap file). Can be called after collect if the resource is no longer needed, or in the catch block of an exception. The cleanup method of SwapOutputStream does nothing.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws IOException
        Calls flush() on the underlying output stream if the SwapOutputStream has started writing to it. Otherwise this method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface Flushable
        Overrides:
        flush in class OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException

      • closeSwapToStream

        public void closeSwapToStream()
                       throws IOException
        Closes the underlying output stream. Regular code does not have to call this method, because the collect method already implicitly closes the output stream. However you may have to call this method if you find yourself in the catch block of an exception.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Does nothing. Notably this method doesn't close the underlying output stream as this is done either implicitly by the collect method or explicitly by the closeSwapToStream method. Therefore it's probably rather more than less confusing to instantiate a SwapOutputStream using a try-with-resources block, as the collect method would have to be called within the try-with-resources block.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Overrides:
        close in class OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException

      • swap

        public void swap()
          throws IOException
        Forces the internal buffer to be flushed the underlying output stream, even if the internal buffer has not reached full capacity yet. You should not ordinarily have to call this method, but it might be useful for debug purposes (e.g. to inspect a swap file).
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs
